user.name: Gabriel Yee
user.bio:
ABOUT ME

Gabriel Yee, 15
Washington DC, USA

I am an individual who enjoys taking up challenges more mature than myself. My main background and projects are in Software Development and Data Analytics, which I had the pleasure of working on during my extracurriculars. I love working in teams because of the incredible insight that each individual contributes. Plus, it makes the work so much more enjoyable!

When I’m not coding, you’ll find me playing chess (I played in the Maryland Scholastic 2025 Championship and the SuperNationals VII) or doomscrolling my life away.

work.title: Full Stack Dev
work.description:
Quicko
Full Stack Developer
Ahmedabad, India
May 2021 - June 2023

Tech Stack: Java SpringBoot, Node.js, Angular, Flutter, DynamoDb, Oracle SQL, AWS, GCP, Docker, Jenkins, Git

Led development of India's top online tax advisory platform, automating scheduling, payments, and order lifecycle with Flutter, Node.js, and AWS, boosting revenue by 80%.

Optimized scheduling using AWS CloudFront and EventBridge, cutting API response time from 4s to 200ms.

Developed a PWA for income tax filing, integrated with major Indian brokerage apps, onboarding 500,000+ users in 2022.

Developed Clique, Quicko’s affiliate app with Angular and Java SpringBoot, reaching 800,000 sign-ups through 100+ affiliates.

Streamlined email marketing with Listmonk and AWS Lambda, analyzing AWS SES open events and saving $800 monthly by eliminating subscription fees.

Implemented AWS Lambda middleware in Java and Node.js, reducing cold start time from 3-4s to <50ms.

Established data retrieval patterns for DynamoDB, optimizing querying and pagination for better cost and access efficiency.

work.title: Application Dev Intern
work.description:
Evosys
Application Development Intern
Ahmedabad, India
Jan 2021 - May 2021

Tech Stack: Javascript, PL-SQL, MySQL, Java, Oracle Cloud Infrastructure

Developed Step-Function-like workflows using Oracle Integrations Cloud and PL-SQL procedures, establishing a data tunnel between Oracle Fusion Applications.

Implemented an Oracle Integration Cloud Service (OICS) workflow to automate file transfer, processing, and delivery via SFTP, improving efficiency and reducing manual intervention.

projects.name: Pro-folio
projects.description: Portfolio for pros. This is a portfolio website for software developers. The code is open sourced, enabling anyone to make quick meta data changes and load up their own portfolio website.

projects.name: IMG2PGN
projects.description: Streamlining the digitization of chess notation sheets. By uploading a photo of your chess notation sheet, the program extracts the text and converts it into a usable PGN.

projects.name: JagBots Scouter
projects.description: A high-end analytical website designed to allow FRC teams to better scout and analyze the competition.

projects.name: WordHunt
projects.description: Developed alongside three others, this program won first place in the Brook Codes hackathon. This program recreates the popular iOS GamePigeon game, WordHunt for the web.

projects.name: ScoreTracker
projects.description: A simple, clean two team score tracker for usage on touchscreen devices
